newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia economic growth seen 7.8 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia economic growth seen 7.8 pct in 1996.

text.p: President Suharto said on Tuesday that Indonesia's economy was expected to grow by around 7.8 percent in 1996, compared with 8.2 percent in 1995.
He said in his year-end message to the nation that inflation was expected to be around 6.7 percent, against 8.6 percent in 1995.

"We have achieved various important advances in the economic field. Economic growth this year remained high, around 7.8 percent, (but) a bit slower when compared with 8.2 percent in 1995," Suharto said.
"We can contain inflation to around 6.7 percent, lower than last year's inflation of 8.6 percent," he said.
He said the economy was stable although there was a current account deficit.
"The improvement in the economic field has brought positive impacts on other development sectors. However, we are aware that there are weaknesses and shortcomings that we must overcome.
"We must overcome the development gap between sectors, regions or economic groups. We must overcome this by accelerating equitability in all fields," Suharto said.
He said the government would continue with programmes to eradicate poverty and develop small and medium businesses through partnerships and other measures.
He said Indonesia should strengthen the competitiveness of its goods and services in 1997, both in the domestic and world markets.
